events.name: NLEVELS
events.comment: Number of unique levels per planet

events.title: Player Profile
events.description: Procedures to create or load the player profile.

children.text: Set BGM and SFX according to player's profile.

children.functionDescription: Set BGM and SFX according to player's profile

children.text: Check if player profile already exists.
If so, load it.

actions.text: Set current level based on player's tech points.

children.text: Otherwise, create a new profile.

actions.text: Set current level based on player's tech points.

events.title: Title Screen
events.description: Animations that play as soon as the game starts.

children.name: canGoToMenu
children.comment: Can the player already go to the main menu?

children.text: Load music and backgrounds into memory.
Set input text according to user's platform.
Mobile = Tap
Desktop = Click
Setup animation.

actions.text: Move title parts to the center of the screen.
Let the player go to the main menu.

children.text: Disable Main Menu events and start music system.
Spawn planets and setup initial parameters for the animation.

actions.text: Set its animation according to the current loopindex, so all 3 animations are used.
Start tween that will define how far from the center the planet will be during the animation.
Set orbit to Pivot and use the planet animation name to define its angle offset.
Start hidden to avoid any flicker.

children.text: Bring the planets closer until planetsMinDist is reached, then just orbit around the pivot.
Constantly move stars.
Return progress data to fill text box.

children.functionDescription: Return progress data to fill text box

children.name: sumOfTechs
children.comment: Stores the sum of all tech points

children.text: Calculate the sum of all technology points obtained by the player.
If the player has completed this planet, of course they will have the maximum number of tech points obtainable in the planet.
Otherwise, if the player is still in this planet, get how many points they already have.
Finally, if the player hasn't reached the planet yet, they will not have gotten any tech point there.
If the player can already go to the menu and they touch the screen, play the transition to the main menu.

actions.text: Make play button enabled or disabled depending on the amount of tech points the player has
Quickly move title to the top of the screen.
Disable canGoToMenu, since the player already skipped the title screen.

children.name: finalY
children.comment: Final Y position to place the planet and progress text

children.text: Sequentially move each planet to their main menu position (to show stats), and stop orbiting.

actions.text: Add an offset delay between each planet.
Move planet to corresponding XY position and disable the orbit.
Create progress text and move beside the corresponding planet.

children.text: Sequentially bring menu buttons into the scene.

actions.text: Set SFX/BGM animation frames according to player profile SFX/BGM options.
Add an offset delay between each button.

children.text: Enable Main Menu events.

events.title: Main Menu
events.description: Events related to the main menu functionalities.

children.text: Move "Are you sure" frame away.
Move "Are you sure" frame away.
Bring default menu items into view

actions.text: Add an offset delay between each button.

children.text: Executed when Button Play is pressed.

children.functionDescription: Executed when Button Play is pressed

children.text: Executed when Button Reset is pressed.

children.functionDescription: Executed when Button Reset is pressed

children.text: Move default menu items away.

actions.text: Add an offset delay between each button.

children.text: Bring "Are you sure" frame into view.
Executed when Button SFX is pressed.

children.functionDescription: Executed when Button SFX is pressed

children.text: Executed when Button BGM is pressed.

children.functionDescription: Executed when Button BGM is pressed

children.text: Executed when Button Yes from "Are you sure" is pressed.

children.functionDescription: Executed when Button Yes from "Are you sure" is pressed

actions.text: Set current level based on player's tech points.

children.text: Executed when Button No from "Are you sure" is pressed.

children.functionDescription: Executed when Button No from "Are you sure" is pressed

children.text: When player start touching a button, it gets pressed.
When player releases a pressed button, return to normal state and execute corresponding action.
If the player presses a button, then moves the cursor away from that button, do not run the action.
Play Button.
Reset Button.
SFX Button.
BGM Button.
"Are you sure" Yes Button.
"Are you sure" No Button.
